alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 12:53AM EDT until March 20 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Smithfield. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 15.0 Fri 12 am ED 16.4 16.1 15.0 14.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 100 PM EDT.
